results.content:
Filip is an Angular master, I would 't take this course if you are new to javascript or programming in general as there are some concepts that can get very confusing if you don't understand what Filip is Talking about. However, the number of exercises, the explanations, the speed of his responses on his slack channel, and the efficiency of his code have made of this course one of the best ones I have ever taken in my life. I would 100% take this web development course rather than taking a diploma at a university. I speak from experience, I learned more on Filip's course than in one year on a web development course.

Keep the good work Filip!!

results.content: Started looking on Udemy to beef up my web development skills since almost every job I see has "AngularJS experience preferred" or "React/Redux experience preferred". This course taught me everything I would need to know to be able to apply these skills in the real world and feel confident using Angular and React in a professional setting. Filip takes his time and makes sure you understand all the code that is written while also explaining the fundamental concepts behind Angular and React.

results.content: This course and instructor are something special. I've taken many fantastic courses on Udemy from a variety of instructors.  This course takes it to another level.  There's a ton of useful content.  Not only does it walk through coding an extremely robust professional quality application, but along the way I've also finally started to really understand the React design pattern.  Filip does a great job of explaining the why and the how behind everything.  He is extremely helpful and responsive to students.  You'll learn about best practices to manage your workflow, effectively use source control, structure your code, and deploy to a production environment.  By the end you'll have a really impressive app and the knowledge of how to build something similar on your own.  Highly, highly recommended.
results.content_html: This course and instructor are something special. I've taken many fantastic courses on Udemy from a variety of instructors. This course takes it to another level. There's a ton of useful content. Not only does it walk through coding an extremely robust professional quality application, but along the way I've also finally started to really understand the React design pattern. Filip does a great job of explaining the why and the how behind everything. He is extremely helpful and responsive to students. You'll learn about best practices to manage your workflow, effectively use source control, structure your code, and deploy to a production environment. By the end you'll have a really impressive app and the knowledge of how to build something similar on your own. Highly, highly recommended.

results.content:
This is a really good course for those who wants to learn something about angular and react. The project is very popular, with both MEAN and MERN stack, which also provide the comparison between them for better understanding. To be honest, I learn web development , including angular and node.js in university. But I learn more from this course. Filip is very responsive. He explained everything clearly in detail. He responded very fast if you have any questions. I'm almost done with this course and I also have some advice for Filip:
1. It would be better to add english caption for your next course:>
2. Maybe you can add more lectures based on this project, such as real-time chatting with socket.io, mocha testing... which could make this fancy project even better. And we can learn more stuffs. 

I like everything about this course. I'm really looking forward to Filip next course!

results.content:
I took this course because the MERN stack project presented in the previews looked much more in depth and had way more features compared to other courses and projects I have seen before.

This course has not disappointed so far. His use of the Google Maps API, HOC's, Authentication, etc for the course project are some of the coolest features and best code I have seen written for MERN in a while. 

My constructive feedback for this course is that the way the Instructor explains the basics of React, Redux, HOC's in the beginning are too fast paced and do not provide enough detail.  This was not an issue for me as I am well versed in React already, and simply wanted to IMPROVE my React skills rather than relearn the basics.

The instructor is passionate, responds quickly to questions, and is continually adding new features such as Image Uploads for the project which I am super excited for. I will definitely be keeping an eye out for future content by this instructor.

TLDR: This course is great for increasing your React Skills and creating an Awesome MERN Project. However, if you are trying to learn the basics of React,  I would suggest other courses.

response.content: Hello Kevin. Thank you for in-detail review and feedback. Much appreciated (:
response.content_html: Hello Kevin. Thank you for in-detail review and feedback. Much appreciated (:

response.content_html: Thank you Jose. Have fun learning with my course (:

results.content_html: It's a great course, I like the modularity of the lessons. They are short and you can understand what's happening.

results.content:
I love how simply and clearly Filip describes new topics with wireframes, take somewhat complex topics and summarizing them down into understandable chunks (ie description of how redux works, how state works and how props are passed around, etc). That provides a lot of value to me. 

I only have one small suggestion, and that is the same suggestion that I've given in the other class I've taken with Filip, and that is to please utilize a little bit more "assignments" where the students have to problem solve for themselves to try to make something before you explain it. I sometimes try to force myself to try to do something before you do it, but its even better when you force your students to come up with more solutions themselves before you explain it, I find it increases learning ;)
results.content_html:
I love how simply and clearly Filip describes new topics with wireframes, take somewhat complex topics and summarizing them down into understandable chunks (ie description of how redux works, how state works and how props are passed around, etc). That provides a lot of value to me.

I only have one small suggestion, and that is the same suggestion that I've given in the other class I've taken with Filip, and that is to please utilize a little bit more "assignments" where the students have to problem solve for themselves to try to make something before you explain it. I sometimes try to force myself to try to do something before you do it, but its even better when you force your students to come up with more solutions themselves before you explain it, I find it increases learning ;)

Great explanation to the topics and very practical.

Thanks! and great job!
